The food was very tasty and delicious.  I wasn't super hungry so I just ordered the ham and Brie sandwich and a coffee with milk while my boo had one of the breakfast specials which had toast and a potato quiche (a tortilla I think they called it).  The server and people there were incredibly kind and friendly in helping us with the menu considering my Spanish was not very good.  I was very surprised and somewhat moved with how kind they were to a few bumbling jet-lagged American tourists who stumbled into their cafe probably committing faux pas every moment we were there.  I will definitely go back again while I'm here.  Very quaint and great place.
